sen.e: The Isso school is one of fue-kata (flute players) schools of Nohgaku (the art of Noh).

sen.j: 名人笛彦兵衛の弟子中村七郎左衛門が一家を立て、子の又三郎が一噌似斎とも称したところから流儀の名が興った。
sen.e: Shichirozaemon NAKAMURA, who was a follower of a flute master named Hikobe FUE, established this family, and the name of the school originated from his son named Matasaburo because he called himself Jisai ISSO.

sen.j: 三世八郎右衛門以降は一噌を姓とし、江戸時代は宝生流の座付きとして活躍した。
sen.e: The third generation head named Hachirouemon began to use Isso as their family name, and the school gave great performances exclusively for the Hosho school during the Edo period.

sen.j: 近代の名人に十二世宗家一噌又六郎、島田巳久馬（一時宗家代理）、一噌正之助、藤田大五郎（人間国宝）などがいる。
sen.e: The school had some great performers including the 12th generation head named Matarokuro ISSO, Mikuma SHIMADA (he temporarily acted as a deputy head of the family), Shonosuke ISSO, and Daigoro FUJITA (he was a Living National Treasure) during the early-modern times.

sen.j: 吹き込みを鋭く、装飾音を控え、簡素で力強い表現を目指すのが特色で、譜の構造は他流と大きく違う。
sen.e: The remarkable features of this school are shrill blasts, modest grace notes, and simple and powerful expression, and the structure of their music scores is totally different from other schools' scores.
